documents.document: @benwerd an exception may be in emerging areas of the world which have different requirements/ constraints
@nbloom @kaler write me a blog post, we’ll share it. Or find me one to reference, please!
@cambel @nbloom that’s @MannyPadda!
@kaler @nbloom @AngelCapCanada there is a difference between theory & practice. One benefit is founder-investor alignment.
@cambel @nbloom “The average deal size was $1.16 million” (lots of undercounting, since this is mainly groups)
@cambel @nbloom it’s a reporting framework by angels that are connected into @AngelCapCanada — full report here: https://t.co/XHDzxcAOWz
@cambel @nbloom no idea — wouldn’t show up unless reported by angels into @AngelCapCanada (that’s the source set).
@nbloom we did Commons at @fullstack. Some US investors have freaked re: options + tax treatment of Commons. Good discussion to have.
Not new numbers, but looking at this in context of #NACOCommonDocs. Other includes SAFE. https://t.co/dxgKwdEl5e
2015 investment type via @AngelCapCanada: Common Shares - 45% Preferred Shares - 23% Convertible Debt - 28% Debt (loan) - 3% Other - 1%
@GRIDSVancouver meet my friends at @helloprettysa who can connect you
Great company and team. Distributed. https://t.co/cgesbcR6VX
@HudPeter for sure. This is why I’m glad I finally get to do this. Lots of education needed.
“Help gaming devs gain product mentality, & sw devs understand 3D” @hitsmachines https://t.co/KSW7Fp7rM5 https://t.co/SV6Aq9CgbK
Very cool new Dev tool from the Tapstream crew. https://t.co/RLW0Vv51V9
@jaypozo interesting. I find many people don’t know about multi-account Chrome. Solves problem for me.
Most common feedback from founders “OMG I need this yesterday - no one can tell me what is standard here” #NACOCommonDocs
Most common feedback from Canadian investors so far is “SAFEs are crazy”. Looking forward to more discussion #NACOCommonDocs
The team at @thejibe have up to 6 desks available in their #Vancouver Gastown office, either singles or a team.
@jaypozo how is this different than using the Chrome “people” function?
@walkah April! Or find me a job and I’ll live in your basement
@walkah one thinks interesting thoughts when in Africa, where no cloud providers have a data center yet
@walkah still need web proxies. I experimented with a blockchain blog + PHP frontend. More about those w/ only a phone as computing device
@walkah mobile phones, the next billion, p2p where data is $, and even $10/yr for domain name being a barrier.
@walkah I have a mediachain install on Digital Ocean that I’m going to take a shot with. Doesn’t fix the not caring part ;)
@walkah I have to rescue my Flickr photos this year. Ads every 4th click :(
@walkah may as well generalize it and do photo galleries too
@walkah we should have a not-blogging club that podcasts about it
@walkah p2p! It’s in the cloud! At least I’m not renting identifiers from DNS, instead I get to have a UUID I can’t remember
@walkah I forgot to ask you about this. But I’m done with anything semi-permanent. I’m going to not blog on a p2p blockchain.
@konobi @nredmond VR/AR/MR is a continuum. I very much believe in it as next gen interface, esp. on mobile. Yes, it will replace screens.
@nredmond unfortunately, mainly services firms. We just don’t have the investment base to make this work.
Via @evanwolf some thoughts on how @SlackHQ is culmination of a decade of Web2 comms & interactions https://t.co/zkGwwewG1M
Interesting. I pretty much want all of these things link saving things as bots. And “backup” to somewhere I own/con… https://t.co/TUsUdOE54S
@awesome I got burned by file world a long time ago, so I’m out
Dropbox wants to unite "file world & cloud world". https://t.co/vVrqBMa9on https://t.co/sNJC7RN49F
You don’t get Series A/B rounds through public pitches. https://t.co/qTpP0Wrm0o
Adventure Owl is whimsical. It makes no claims about solving backaches https://t.co/qxhWaddorR 🦉
@duanebrown that is both an interesting and a commodity piece. We’ll have lots to chat about.
@duanebrown opportunity! Also: bots can replace some fraction of those people.
OH Investor categorization of companies: Data is the new bacon, Volleyball with Strangers, Shopping with Jesus

@portertech congrats Sean & @sensu team!
@mediachain_ can individuals upload / namespace their personal photos into mediachain? I’m technical & want to tinker. Best place to start?

@geo_will it’s just telling you to take the day off
Pretty fun taking an @OpenAngelCanada presenting company from Vancouver to Toronto. More cross country flow! https://t.co/TSFL7yYccL

At the @crowdmatrixinc pitch event. Smiling @leahjcarr greeting me. https://t.co/Pz5Sxs2MN3
In honour of my two favourite devs-opsians @walkah @termie https://t.co/4MTBt5b7F6
@jkparker point being they are terrible & make me wait to manually run card AND charge fee for card payment!
@jkparker there is lots of Uber here. I have used both & the actual cabs are more painful other than exit-bar-flag-down-cab
#Toronto cabs insult to injury edition: $1.50 service charge for using debit/credit.
Just figured out what @walkah’s PHD stands for
If you’re looking at your first or second startup seed round in Vancouver, apply https://t.co/Sd3uBkytZP
A lot of dismissiveness of Mozilla by people who don’t understand they’re measuring success differently. Great… https://t.co/68yeRU11Rt
One learning from #NACOCommonDocs today: founder- vs. investor-led term sheets needs consideration for terms, process, & education.
Kicking off #NACOCommonDocs in Toronto at JLABS https://t.co/a6l6M7NYLw
The DesignLab / LumoHacks crew is looking to put on a VR workshop in #Vancouver, take their survey https://t.co/GCWVdmFgOS
Vancouver gardening app @mygreenspaceco pitching in Toronto Friday with @crowdmatrixinc. I’ll be there! https://t.co/laTkSw4fCd
Chinese Restaurant Awards 2017. Documented in the wiki so that I can work my way through the list https://t.co/DHGpMPxeHD
@marypcbuk @stevesi post-PC is painful as we fully shed professional desktop OS for mass market & niche vertical use cases
@stevesi having spent some time w Chromebooks, it brings “native code” apps that don’t fit web / browser model. Plus appstore distribution.
My Deploy to Heroku buttons made it to the main README of @superscriptjs https://t.co/k6bOXAgiAt - I recommend a Slack bot 👋🤖
@Caravel_Law glad to have you as part of this!
@otri cool! Where to download? Also: recos on other iOS apps that work with Structure scanner?
@ekryski happy to chat. #NACOCommonDocs effort focused on term sheets / investments — less so any other docs
@ekryski we’re putting together canonical terms + education. Legal firms are main contributors. Happy to have more input.
@cambel the internet https://t.co/rVU53GgoRW
@cambel @akalsey I believe you missed my comments on this matter
@jb55 @reiver especially because they should focus on regulation & safety, rather than economics
@reiver no. The Provincial Transportation Safety Board has regulation that private car trips cost a min of $50, no matter length of trip
Woot! #NACOCommonDocs now has legal sponsors across country: welcome @BennetJonesLaw @mcinnescooper @Caravel_Law - see you next week in TO
What if we removed REPLYALL from email clients by default?
@akalsey definitely a jr. That’s not even a GIF
Congrats to the @500Canada team. Looking forward to seeing them add some firepower to Canadian early stage investin… https://t.co/vDkp42Wdtx
@SlackHQ I had informally been using ^^^ <msg> to add a comment to a shared link, but that’s awk on mobile. Thanks for considering!
Hey @SlackHQ can you respond-as-a-thread via just keyboard? I propose /thread <msg> to respond to prev message as a thread
@DropboxSupport AT-mention links to Paper docs, create my own templates, better offline support.
@keithwhor @gringene_bio ssshhh. Don’t be all reasonable & Canadian!! Trying to stoke the fires on some clicks yo! 🇨🇦🔥
The @keithwhor is getting fed up with “serverless” & actually tries to explain it ;) https://t.co/R3Xxs81MOg
@thejonotron yes I kicked the tires on that. DB Paper fills what I need. I’m experimenting with a full on wiki to build a big bag of facts.
@ryan emacs-ing?
I like @chriscorrigan’s term “industrial creatives” to disambiguate from artists. And no, we don’t support arts enuf https://t.co/EWnXKD35LY
@chriscorrigan I like that term, industrial creatives. And no, they (me?) don’t do enough buying of art, going to shows.
@toddsmithdesign <gnashing of teeth, rending of garments> thank you.
Every time I watch Midnight Diner, I want to make the dishes. Tonight, hot pot: clay pot, Chinese cabbage, enoki, pork, in bonito broth
I think I’m moving on from Quip. Dropbox Paper is not as good, but if you’re using DB already, means one less tool.
Participatory Governance in #opensource by @mikeal https://t.co/Akpk5fv7U5 < great thinking on how $$$ doesn’t solve structural issues
Biz Dev / sales growth role doing good & selling tech to cities https://t.co/uwbcsI8427
@rastin Tumblr exists, personal blogs exists. They may even be in larger numbers than at the “beginning” of blogging. SM silos much larger.
@rastin depends on what you mean by “personal” and “blogging” :) Who are you writing for and why?
@jbeda 12.5% of the cost of a Slack account. The space is going to get interesting ;)
Prepping for @AngelCapCanada #NACOCommonDocs next week in #Toronto. Ping me if you want to participate in early stage term sheets.
While I’m bullish on mobile VR, the content for it will be created on desktop. Great prototyping tools spinning up. https://t.co/HupEmtidJu
@Lewwwk @rob_ellis of course, happy to help. Was a good excuse to dive in.
